title: Interacting with BibTeX Databases
text: R-package manage bibliographic references. package focused data import-export data frame format based software JabRef.

title: Interacting with BibTeX Databases
text: can install package GitHub.
code: library(remotes) install_github("kamapu/biblio")

title: Interacting with BibTeX Databases
text: copy references cited book Luebert & Pliscoff (2016) also installed package.
code: library(biblio) Bib <- read_bib(x = file.path(path.package("biblio"), "LuebertPliscoff.bib")) Bib #> Object of class 'lib_df' #>  #> Number of references: 1701 #> Number of variables: 23 #> Duplicated entries: FALSE

what: Scanning Cited References in R-Markdown Documents
title: Interacting with BibTeX Databases
text: example r-markdown document also installed test function detect_keys(), able recognize bibtexkeys use within r-markdown document. Alternatively last option, can use function read_rmd() package yamlme. Note case position citation may change detect_keys() start counting lines yaml-header. output shows respective bibtexkey occurrence document (line number). output also possible statistics.
code: my_document <- readLines(file.path(path.package("biblio"), "document.Rmd")) cited_refs <- detect_keys(my_document) cited_refs #>        bibtexkey line #> 1 oberdorfer1960   10 #> 2     veblen1995   12 #> 3     veblen1996   12 #> 4 oberdorfer1960   15 #> 5 oberdorfer1960   19 #> 6     veblen1996   24 #> 7   pollmann2004   24 #> 8    ramirez2005   29 library(yamlme) my_document <- read_rmd(file.path(path.package("biblio"), "document.Rmd")) #> The yaml-header is not imported by this fucnion. Use 'update()' to re-write the header. cited_refs <- detect_keys(my_document) #> Lines are counted only at the body of the document. cited_refs #>        bibtexkey line #> 1 oberdorfer1960    4 #> 2     veblen1995    6 #> 3     veblen1996    6 #> 4 oberdorfer1960    9 #> 5 oberdorfer1960   13 #> 6     veblen1996   18 #> 7   pollmann2004   18 #> 8    ramirez2005   23 stats_refs <- aggregate(line ~ bibtexkey, data = cited_refs, FUN = length)  # Number of citations in text sum(stats_refs$line) #> [1] 8  # Number of cited articles nrow(stats_refs) #> [1] 5  # Respective frequency to know rare citations in text stats_refs[order(stats_refs$line, decreasing = TRUE), ] #>        bibtexkey line #> 1 oberdorfer1960    3 #> 5     veblen1996    2 #> 2   pollmann2004    1 #> 3    ramirez2005    1 #> 4     veblen1995    1

title: Interacting with BibTeX Databases
text: package yamlme enables use functions write R-markdown documents render . context, function reflist() produce automatically reference list. Note assigning output reflist() new object using package yamlme, may able modify layout using function update(). Remember set Note rendering updated document also require written bibtex file, thus sharing input bibtexfile lib_df object within R-image may secure way enable repeatability.
code: Bib2 <- subset(x = Bib, subset = as.integer(year) > 2005) reflist(obj = Bib2, filename = "my_reflist") library(yamlme)  # Subset and assignment Bib2 <- subset(x = Bib, subset = as.integer(year) > 2005) my_reflist <- reflist(x = Bib2, filename = "my_reflist", browse_file = FALSE)  # Updating and rendering my_reflist <- update(         object = my_reflist,         title = "Reference List (PDF version)",         author = "myself",         output = "pdf_document",         body = txt_body(                 "\\setlength{\\parindent}{-5mm}",                 "\\setlength{\\leftskip}{5mm}",                 "\\setlength{\\parskip}{8pt}")) render_rmd(my_reflist, output_file = "my_reflist")

title: Compare data frames and libraries — compare_df
code: # Partially matching libraries Refs1 <- synopsis[1:10, ] Refs2 <- synopsis[6:15, ]  # some modification in second library Refs2[3, "title"] <- "New Title"  # compare libraries compare_df(Refs1, Refs2) #> ## deleted entries (5): #> 'rovira2006' 'luebert2004-2' 'pliscoff2006' 'smith-ramirez2005' 'flores_meza2016' #>  #> ## added entries (5): #> 'gajardo1983' 'gajardo1994-2' 'lomolino2010' 'shelford1931' 'austin2013' #>  #> ## updates in entry 'ramirez1989-6' #>  - old title: Cambios estacionales de frecuencia y cobertura en una pradera del Centro Sur de Chile #>  - new title: New Title #>

title: Detect bibtexkeys used in an r-markdown document — detect_keys

title: Detect bibtexkeys used in an r-markdown document — detect_keys
text: x character vector, file imported readLines() object imported read_rmd(). character vector name Rmd file, readLines() internally called read . ... arguments passed among methods. character-method passed readLines().

title: Detect bibtexkeys used in an r-markdown document — detect_keys
text: data frame two columns, bibtexkey found keys line line number occurrence key document.

title: Detect bibtexkeys used in an r-markdown document — detect_keys
code: ## Read installed r-markdown document my_document <- readLines(file.path(path.package("biblio"), "document.Rmd"))  ## Screen for citations cited_refs <- detect_keys(my_document) cited_refs #>        bibtexkey line #> 1 oberdorfer1960   10 #> 2     veblen1995   12 #> 3     veblen1996   12 #> 4 oberdorfer1960   15 #> 5 oberdorfer1960   19 #> 6     veblen1996   24 #> 7   pollmann2004   24 #> 8    ramirez2005   29

what: Write a Reference List in rmarkdown — reflist
title: Write a Reference List in rmarkdown — reflist
text: fast way produce reference list r-markdown document lib_df object. function may may produce intermediate files (bib Rmd) result can assigned object edition (see yamlme::update()). html file written write_rmd() render_rmd() working directory displayed browseURL().

title: Write a Reference List in rmarkdown — reflist
code: reflist(x, ...)  # S3 method for character reflist(   x,   output_file,   delete_source = TRUE,   title = "Automatic Reference List",   output = "html_document",   nocite = "'@*'",   urlcolor = "blue",   encoding = "UTF-8",   ... )  # S3 method for lib_df reflist(x, filename, delete_source = TRUE, ...)

title: Write a Reference List in rmarkdown — reflist
text: x lib_df object produce reference list. character method, character value indicating path bibtex file (passed read_bib()). ... arguments passed yaml header intermediate Rmarkdown document. output_file character value name written Rmarkdown file. delete_source logical value indicating whether written bib file deleted rendering html . title, output, nocite, urlcolor Arguments used yaml-header r-markdown passed write_rmd(). can cancelled using value NULL (recommended nocite). encoding character value indicating encoding string. passed write_bib(). filename character value name written Rmd file, without file extension.

title: Write a Reference List in rmarkdown — reflist
text: invisible object class rmd_doc. Rmd file written write_rmd() well.

title: Write a Reference List in rmarkdown — reflist
code: if (FALSE) { reflist(synopsis) }

title: Update data frames — update_data
text: function compares two versions data frame detect changes additions, deleted entries updates (modified entries). method compare lib_df objects also provided well replace method.

title: Update data frames — update_data
code: update_data(object, revision, key, ...)  # S4 method for data.frame,data.frame,character update_data(   object,   revision,   key,   add = FALSE,   delete = FALSE,   update = FALSE,   ... )  # S4 method for lib_df,lib_df,missing update_data(object, revision, key, ...)  update_data(object, key, ...) <- value  # S4 method for data.frame,character,data.frame update_data(object, key, ...) <- value  # S4 method for lib_df,missing,lib_df update_data(object, key, ...) <- value

title: Update data frames — update_data
text: object data frame lib_df object representing original version. revision updated version 'object' compared. key character value indicating column used identifier. variable versions otherwise function retrieve error. ... arguments passed among methods. delete, add, update Logical value indicating whether action carried . 'FALSE', function just report differences done compare_df. value updated version 'object' replace methods.

title: Update data frames — update_data
text: Either invisible output print console updated object class lib_df.

title: Update data frames — update_data
code: # Adding an ID to data set iris iris2 <- iris iris2$id <- 1:nrow(iris2)  # rows to add using mean values per species iris_mod <- aggregate(cbind(   Sepal.Length, Sepal.Width, Petal.Length,   Petal.Width ) ~ Species, data = iris2, FUN = mean) iris_mod$id <- (1:nrow(iris_mod)) + nrow(iris2) iris_mod <- do.call(rbind, list(iris2, iris_mod[, colnames(iris2)]))  # delete some entries iris_mod <- iris_mod[-c(15, 75, 105, 145), ]  # modify entries iris_mod$Petal.Length[c(20, 30)] <- 0 iris_mod$Petal.Width[c(20, 50)] <- 0  # just a comparison update_data(iris2, iris_mod, key = "id") #> ## deleted entries (4): #> '15' '75' '105' '145' #>  #> ## added entries (3): #> '151' '152' '153' #>  #> ## updates in entry '21' #>  - old Petal.Length: 1.7 #>  - new Petal.Length: 0 #>  #>  - old Petal.Width: 0.2 #>  - new Petal.Width: 0 #>  #> ## updates in entry '31' #>  - old Petal.Length: 1.6 #>  - new Petal.Length: 0 #>  #> ## updates in entry '51' #>  - old Petal.Width: 1.4 #>  - new Petal.Width: 0 #>   # do update iris2 <- update_data(iris2, iris_mod,   key = "id", delete = TRUE, add = TRUE,   update = TRUE )
